1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		locate_module.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description: 	Contains the routines which locate the actual	     **
14   |  **			modulefile given a modulefilename by looking in all  **
15   |  **			of the paths in MODULEPATH. 			     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
18   |  **			SortedDirList					     **
19   |  **			SplitIntoList					     **
20   |  **			FreeList					     **
21   |  **			SourceRC					     **
22   |  **			SourceVers					     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  **   Notes:								     **
25   |  ** 									     **
26   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
27   |  ****/
28   | 
29   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
30   |  ** 									     **
31   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
32   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
33   |  ** 									     ** 
34   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | 
36   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: locate_module.c.src.html,v 1.6.30.1 2010/11/11 18:23:20 rkowen Exp $";
37   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
38   |

53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | 
55   | #define	SRCFRAG	100
56   | 
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
60   | 
61   | /** not applicable **/

65   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
66   | 
67   | static	char	module_name[] = "locate_module.c";	/** File name of this module **/
68   | 
69   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
70   | static	char	_proc_Locate_ModuleFile[] = "Locate_ModuleFile";
71   | #endif
72   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
73   | static	char	_proc_GetModuleName[] = "GetModuleName";
74   | #endif
75   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
76   | static	char	_proc_SortedDirList[] = "SortedDirList";
77   | static	char	_proc_SplitIntoList[] = "SplitIntoList";
78   | #endif
79   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
80   | static	char	_proc_FreeList[] = "FreeList";
81   | #endif
82   | 
83   | static	char	buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
84   | static	char	modfil_buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
85   | 
86   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
87   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
88   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
89   | 
90   | static	int	  filename_compare( const void*, const void*);
91   | static	char	 *GetModuleName( Tcl_Interp*, char*, char*, char*);
92   | 
93   | /*++++
94   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   Function:		filename_compare				     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Description: 	This is a reverse compare function to reverse the    **
99   |  **			filename list. The function is used as compare func- **
100  |  **			tion for qsort.					     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	const void	*fi1	First filename to compare    **
105  |  **			const void	*fi2	Second filename to compare   **
106  |  ** 									     **
107  |  **   Result:		int	-1	filename 1 > filename 2		     **
108  |  **				0	filename 1 == filename 2	     **
109  |  **				1	filename 1 < filename 2		     **
110  |  ** 									     **
111  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
112  |  ** 									     **
113  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
114  |  ++++*/
115  | 
116  | static int  filename_compare(	const void	*fi1,
117  | 				const void	*fi2)
118  | {
119  |     return strcmp(*(char**)fi2, *(char**)fi1);
120  | }
121  | 
122  | /*++++
123  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
124  |  ** 									     **
125  |  **   Function:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
126  |  ** 									     **
127  |  **   Description:	Searches for a modulefile given a string argument    **
128  |  **			which is either a full path or a modulefile name     **
129  |  **			-- usually the argument the user gave. If it's not a **
130  |  **			full path, the directories in the MODULESPATH	     **
131  |  **			environment variable are searched to find a match    **
132  |  **			for the given name.				     **
133  |  ** 									     **
134  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
135  |  ** 									     **
136  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl interpr.**
137  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module to**
138  |  **							be located	     **
139  |  **			char		*realname	Real modulename (with**
140  |  **							version)	     **
141  |  **			char		*filename	Real    full module  **
142  |  **							file path	     **
143  |  ** 									     **
144  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK or TCL_ERROR		     **
145  |  **			filename	the full path of the required module **
146  |  **					file is copied in here		     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
149  |  **						by the current command	     **
150  |  ** 									     **
151  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
152  |  ++++*/
153  | 
154  | int Locate_ModuleFile(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
155  |                   	char		*modulename,
156  |                   	char		*realname,
157  |                   	char		*filename)
158  | {
159  |     char	*p;			/** Tokenization pointer	     **/
160  |     char	*result = NULL;		/** This functions result	     **/
161  |     char	**pathlist;		/** List of paths to scan	     **/
162  |     int		  numpaths,		/** Size of this list		     **/
163  |     		  i;			/** Loop counter		     **/
164  |     char	*modulespath;		/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
165  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
166  |     char	*mod, *vers;		/** Module and version name for sym- **/
167  | 					/** bolic name lookup		     **/
168  |     /**
169  |      **  If it is a full path name, that's the module file to load.
170  |      **/
171  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
172  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, "modulename = '",
173  | 	modulename, "'", NULL);
174  | #endif
175  | 
176  |     if( !modulename) 
177  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "modulename", NULL))
178  | 	    goto unwind0;
179  | 	
180  |     if( modulename[0] == '/' || modulename[0] == '.') {
181  | 
182  | 	p = (char*) strrchr( modulename, '/');
183  |         if(p) {
184  |             *p = '\0';
185  | 	    /**
186  | 	     **  Check, if what has been specified is a valid version of
187  | 	     **  the specified module ...
188  | 	     **/
189  |             if((char *) NULL ==
190  | 		(result = GetModuleName(interp, modulename, NULL,(p+1)))) 
191  | 		goto unwind0;
192  | 	    /**
193  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
194  | 	     **   tokenization
195  | 	     **/
196  | 	    *p = '/';
197  | 	    /**
198  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
199  | 	     **  tokenization
200  | 	     **/
201  | 	    *p = '/';
202  | 
203  | 	    /**
204  | 	     **  ... Looks good! Conditionally (if there has been no version
205  | 	     **  specified) we have to add the default version
206  | 	     **/
207  |             if( !strcmp((p + 1), result)) {
208  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
209  | 		modulename, NULL))
210  | 		    goto unwind1;
211  |             } else {
212  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
213  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
214  | 		    goto unwind1;
215  |             }
216  |         } else {
217  | 	    /**
218  | 	     **  Hmm! There's no backslash in 'modulename'. So it MUST begin
219  | 	     **  on '.' and MUST be part of the current directory
220  | 	     **/
221  |             if( NULL == (result = GetModuleName( interp, modulename, NULL,
222  | 		modulename)))
223  | 		goto unwind0;
224  | 	
225  |             if( !strcmp( modulename, result) ||
226  | 		(strlen( modulename) + 1 + strlen( result) + 1 > MOD_BUFSIZE)) {
227  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
228  | 		modulename, NULL))
229  | 		    goto unwind1;
230  |             } else {
231  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
232  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
233  | 		    goto unwind1;
234  |             }
235  |         }
236  |     /**
237  |      **  So it is not a full path name what has been specified. Scan the 
238  |      **  MODULESPATH
239  |      **/
240  |     } else {
241  | 	/**
242  | 	 **  If I don't find a path in MODULEPATH, there's nothing to search.
243  | 	 **/
244  | 	if( !( modulespath = (char *) getenv( "MODULEPATH"))) {
245  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL)) {
246  | 		g_current_module = NULL;
247  | 		goto unwind0;
248  | 	    }
249  | 	}
250  | 	/**
251  | 	 ** strip off any extraneous new lines
252  | 	 **/
253  | 	{ char *end;
254  | 	if ((char *) NULL != (end = strrchr(modulespath, '\n'))) *end = '\0';
255  | 	}
256  | 	/**
257  | 	 **  Expand the module name (in case it is a symbolic one). This must
258  | 	 **  be done once here in order to expand any aliases
259  | 	 **/
260  | 	if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
261  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
262  | 	    mod,"/",vers, NULL))
263  | 		goto unwind0;
264  | 	    modulename = buf;
265  | 	}
266  | 	/**
267  | 	 **  Split up the MODULEPATH values into multiple directories
268  | 	 **/
269  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist = SplitIntoList(interp, modulespath, &numpaths,
270  | 	_colon)))
271  | 	    goto unwind0;
272  | 	/**
273  | 	 **  Check each directory to see if it contains the module
274  | 	 **/
275  | 	for(i=0; i<numpaths; i++) {
276  | 	    /* skip empty paths */
277  | 	    if(*pathlist[i] && (NULL != (result =
278  | 		GetModuleName( interp, pathlist[i], NULL, modulename)))) {
279  | 
280  | 		if( strlen( pathlist[i]) + 2 + strlen( result) > MOD_BUFSIZE) {
281  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
282  | 		    pathlist[i], NULL))
283  | 			goto unwind1;
284  | 		} else {
285  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
286  | 		    pathlist[i],"/",result, NULL))
287  | 			goto unwind1;
288  | 		}
289  | 		break;
290  | 	    }
291  | 	    /**
292  | 	     **  If we havn't found it, we should try to re-expand the module
293  | 	     **  name, because some rc file have been sourced
294  | 	     **/
295  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
296  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
297  | 		mod,"/",vers, NULL))
298  | 		    goto unwind1;
299  | 		modulename = buf;
300  | 	    }
301  | 	} /** for **/
302  | 	/**
303  | 	 **  Free the memory created from the call to SplitIntoList()
304  | 	 **/
305  | 	FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
306  | 	/**
307  | 	 **  If result still NULL, then we really never found it and we should
308  | 	 **  return ERROR and clear the full_path array for cleanliness.
309  | 	 **/
310  | 	if( !result) {
311  | 	    filename[0] = '\0';
312  | 	    goto unwind0;
313  | 	}
314  |     } /** not a full path name **/	
315  |     /**
316  |      **  Free up what has been allocated and pass the result back to
317  |      **  the caller and save the real module file name returned by
318  |      **  GetModuleName
319  |      **/
320  |     strncpy( realname, result, MOD_BUFSIZE);
321  |     if ((char *) NULL == stringer( realname, MOD_BUFSIZE, result, NULL))
322  | 	goto unwind1;
323  |     null_free((void *) &result);
324  | 
325  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
326  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, NULL);
327  | #endif
328  | 
329  |     return( TCL_OK);
330  | 
331  | unwind1:
332  |     null_free((void *) &result);
333  | unwind0:
334  |     return( TCL_ERROR);
335  | }
336  | 
337  | /*++++
338  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
339  |  ** 									     **
340  |  **   Function:		GetModuleName					     **
341  |  ** 									     **
342  |  **   Description:	Given a path and a module filename, this function    **
343  |  **			checks to find the modulefile.			     **
344  |  ** 									     **
345  |  **   Notes:		This function is RECURSIVE			     **
346  |  **									     **
347  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
348  |  ** 									     **
349  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
350  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
351  |  **			char		*prefix		Module name prefix   **
352  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
353  |  ** 									     **
354  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL	Any failure( parameters, alloc)	     **
355  |  **				else	Pointer to an allocated buffer con-  **
356  |  **					taining the complete module file path**
357  |  ** 									     **
358  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
359  |  ** 									     **
360  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
361  |  ++++*/
362  | 
363  | static	char	*GetModuleName(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
364  | 			     	char		*path,
365  | 				char		*prefix,
366  | 			     	char		*modulename)
367  | {
368  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
369  |     char	 *fullpath = NULL;	/** Buffer for creating path names   **/
370  |     char	 *Result = NULL;	/** Our return value		     **/
371  |     char	**filelist = NULL;	/** Buffer for a list of possible    **/
372  | 					/** module files		     **/
373  |     int		  numlist;		/** Size of this list		     **/
374  |     int		  i, slen, is_def;
375  |     char	 *s, *t;		/** Private string buffer	     **/
376  |     char	 *mod, *ver;		/** Pointer to module and version    **/
377  |     char	 *mod1, *ver1;		/** Temp pointer		     **/
378  |     
379  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
380  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
381  | #endif
382  |     /**
383  |      **  Split the modulename into module and version. Use a private buffer
384  |      **  for this
385  |      **/
386  |     if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer(NULL, 0,  modulename, NULL))) {
387  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
388  | 	goto unwind0;
389  |     }
390  |     slen = strlen( s) + 1;
391  |     mod = s;
392  |     if( ver = strrchr( mod, '/'))
393  | 	*ver++ = '\0';
394  |     /**
395  |      **  Allocate a buffer for full pathname building
396  |      **/
397  |     if((char *) NULL == (fullpath = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
398  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL)) {
399  | 	    goto unwind1;
400  | 	}
401  |     }
402  |     /**
403  |      **  Check whether $path/$prefix/$modulename is a directory.
404  |      **/
405  |     if( prefix) {
406  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
407  | 	path,"/",prefix,"/",modulename, NULL))
408  | 	    goto unwind1;
409  |     } else {
410  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
411  | 	path,"/",modulename, NULL))
412  | 	    goto unwind1;
413  |     }
414  |     if( !stat( fullpath, &stats) && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
415  | 	/**
416  | 	 ** So the full modulename is $modulename/default.  Recurse on that.
417  | 	 **/
418  | 	if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, 0, modulename, "/",
419  | 					  _default, NULL)))
420  | 	    goto unwind1;
421  | 	Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, prefix, t);
422  | 	null_free((void *) &t);
423  | 	null_free((void *) &fullpath);
424  | 	null_free((void *) &s);
425  | 	return( Result);
426  |     }
427  | 
428  |     /**
429  |      **  Check whether $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory
430  |      **/
431  |     if( prefix) {
432  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
433  | 	path,"/",prefix,"/",mod, NULL))
434  | 	    goto unwind1;
435  |     } else {
436  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
437  | 	path,"/",mod, NULL))
438  | 	    goto unwind1;
439  |     }
440  |     is_def = !strcmp( mod, _default);
441  | 
442  |     if( is_def || !stat( fullpath, &stats)) {
443  | 	/**
444  | 	 **  If it is a directory
445  | 	 **/
446  |     	if( !is_def && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
447  | 	    /**
448  | 	     **  Source the ".modulerc" file if it exists
449  | 	     **  For compatibility source the .version file, too
450  | 	     **/
451  | 	    if( prefix) {
452  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
453  | 		prefix,"/",mod, NULL))
454  | 		    goto unwind2;
455  | 	    } else {
456  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,mod, NULL))
457  | 		    goto unwind2;
458  | 	    }
459  | 
460  | 	    if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
461  | 	    path,"/",modfil_buf, NULL))
462  | 		goto unwind2;
463  | 	    g_current_module = modfil_buf;
464  | 
465  | 	    if(	TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, fullpath, modulerc_file) ||
466  | 		TCL_ERROR == SourceVers( interp, fullpath, modfil_buf)) {
467  | 		/* flags = save_flags; */
468  | 		    goto unwind2;
469  | 	    }
470  | 	    /**
471  | 	     **  After sourcing the RC files, we have to look up versions again
472  | 	     **/
473  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod1, &ver1)) {
474  | 		int len = strlen( mod1) + strlen( ver1) + 2;
475  | 		/**
476  | 		 **  Maybe we have to enlarge s
477  | 		 **/
478  | 		if( len > slen) {
479  | 		    null_free((void *) &s);
480  | 		    if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer( NULL, len, NULL))) {
481  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
482  | 			goto unwind2;
483  | 		    }
484  | 		    slen = len;
485  | 		}
486  | 		/**
487  | 		 **  Print the new module/version in the buffer
488  | 		 **/
489  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer( s, len, mod1,"/", ver1, NULL)) {
490  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
491  | 		    goto unwind2;
492  | 		}
493  | 		mod = s;
494  | 		if( ver = strchr( s, '/'))
495  | 		    *ver++ = '\0';
496  | 	    }
497  | 	    /**
498  | 	     **  recursively delve into subdirectories (until ver == NULL).
499  | 	     **/
500  | 	    if( ver) {
501  | 		int len = strlen( mod) + 1;
502  | 
503  | 		if( prefix)
504  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) +1;
505  | 		/**
506  | 		 **  Build the new prefix
507  | 		 **/
508  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
509  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
510  | 		    goto unwind2;
511  | 		}
512  | 
513  | 		if( prefix) {
514  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, prefix,"/",mod, NULL)){
515  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
516  | 			goto unwindt;
517  | 		    }
518  | 		} else {
519  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, mod, NULL)){
520  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
521  | 			goto unwindt;
522  | 		    }
523  | 		}
524  | 		/**
525  | 		 **  This is the recursion
526  | 		 **/
527  | 		Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, t, ver);
528  | 
529  | 		/**
530  | 		 **  Free our temporary prefix buffer
531  | 		 **/
532  | 		null_free((void *) &t);
533  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
534  | unwindt:
535  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
536  | 		    goto unwind2;
537  | 		}
538  | 	    } 
539  | 	} else {     /** if( $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory) **/
540  | 	    /**
541  | 	     **  Now 'mod' should be either a file or the word 'default'
542  | 	     **  In case of default get the file with the highest version number
543  | 	     **  in the current directory
544  | 	     **/
545  | 	    if( is_def) {
546  | 		if( !prefix)
547  | 		    prefix = ".";
548  | 		if( NULL == (filelist = SortedDirList( interp, path, prefix,
549  | 		&numlist)))
550  | 		    goto unwind1;
551  | 
552  | 		prefix = (char *) NULL;
553  | 		/**
554  | 		 **  Select the first one on the list which is either a
555  | 		 **  modulefile or another directory. We start at the highest
556  | 		 **  lexicographical name in the directory since the filelist
557  | 		 **  is reverse sorted.
558  | 		 **  If it's a directory, we delve into it.
559  | 		 **/
560  | 		for( i=0; i<numlist && Result==NULL; i++) {
561  | 		    /**
562  | 		     **  Build the full path name and check if it is a
563  | 		     **  directory. If it is, recursively try to find there what
564  | 		     **  we're seeking for
565  | 		     **/
566  | 		    if ((char *)NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
567  | 			path, "/", filelist[i], NULL))
568  | 			    goto unwind2;
569  | 
570  | 		    if( !stat( fullpath, &stats) && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
571  | 			Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, prefix,
572  | 			    filelist[ i]);
573  | 		    } else {
574  | 			/**
575  | 			 **  Otherwise check the file for a magic cookie ...
576  | 			 **/
577  | 			if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
578  | 			    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
579  | 			    Result = filelist[ i];
580  | 		    } /** if( !stat) **/
581  | 		} /** for **/
582  | 	    } else {  /** default **/
583  | 		/**
584  | 		 **  If mod names a file, we have to check wheter it exists and
585  | 		 **  is a valid module file
586  | 		 **/
587  | 		if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
588  | 		    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
589  | 		    Result = mod;
590  | 		else {
591  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, fullpath, NULL);
592  | 		    Result = NULL;
593  | 		}
594  | 	    } /** if( mod is a filename) **/
595  | 	    /**
596  | 	     **  Build the full filename (using prefix and Result) if
597  | 	     **  Result is defined
598  | 	     **/
599  | 	    if( Result) {
600  | 		int len = strlen( Result) + 1;
601  | 
602  | 		if( prefix)
603  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) + 1;
604  | 
605  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
606  | 		   ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
607  | 		   goto unwind2;
608  | 		}
609  | 		if( prefix) {
610  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, prefix,"/",Result,NULL))
611  | 			goto unwindt2;
612  | 		} else {
613  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, Result,NULL))
614  | 			goto unwindt2;
615  | 		}
616  | 		Result = t;
617  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
618  | unwindt2:
619  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
620  | 		    goto unwind2;
621  | 		}
622  | 	    } 
623  | 	} /** mod is a file **/
624  |     } /** mod exists **/
625  |     /**
626  |      **  Free up temporary values and return what we've found
627  |      **/
628  |     null_free((void*) &fullpath);
629  |     null_free((void*) &s);
630  |     FreeList( filelist, numlist);
631  |     
632  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
633  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
634  | #endif
635  |     return( Result);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
636  | 
637  | unwind2:
638  |     null_free((void *) &fullpath);
639  | unwind1:
640  |     null_free((void *) &s);
641  | unwind0:
642  |     return(NULL);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
643  | 
644  | } /** End of 'GetModuleName' **/
645  | 
646  | /*++++
647  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
648  |  ** 									     **
649  |  **   Function:		SortedDirList					     **
650  |  ** 									     **
651  |  **   Description:	Checks the given path for the given modulefile.	     **
652  |  **			If the path + the module filename is the modulefile, **
653  |  **			then it is returned as the first element in the list.**
654  |  **			If the path + the module filename is a directory, the**
655  |  **			directory is read and sorted as the list.	     **
656  |  ** 									     **
657  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
658  |  ** 									     **
659  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
660  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
661  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
662  |  **			int		*listcnt	Buffer to return the **
663  |  **							size of the created  **
664  |  **							list in elements     **
665  |  ** 									     **
666  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param)   **
667  |  **					else	Base pointer to the newly    **
668  |  **						created list.		     **
669  |  **			*listcnt		Number of elements in the    **
670  |  **						list if one was created, un- **
671  |  **						changed otherwise	     **
672  |  ** 									     **
673  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
674  |  ** 									     **
675  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
676  |  ++++*/
677  | 
678  | char	**SortedDirList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
679  | 		     		char		*path,
680  | 		     		char		*modulename,
681  | 		     		int		*listcnt)
682  | {
683  |     struct dirent	*file;		/** Directory entry		     **/
684  |     struct stat    	 stats;		/** Stat buffer			     **/
685  |     DIR			*subdirp;	/** Subdirectoy handle		     **/
686  |     char		*full_path;	/** Sugg. full path (path + module)  **/
687  |     char		**filelist;	/** Temp. base pointer of the list   **/
688  |     int			 i,		/** Number of entries in the subdir  **/
689  | 			 j,		/** Counts the number of list-entries**/
690  | 			 n,		/** Size of the allocated array	     **/
691  | 			 pathlen;	/** String length of 'fullpath'	     **/
692  |  
693  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
694  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
695  | #endif
696  |     /**
697  |      **  Allocate memory for the list to be created. Suggest a list size of
698  |      **  100 Elements. This may be changed later on.
699  |      **/
700  |     if( NULL == (filelist = (char**) calloc( n = 100, sizeof(char*))))
701  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
702  | 	    goto unwind0;
703  |     /**
704  |      **  Form the suggested module file name out of the passed path and 
705  |      **  the name of the module. Alloc memory in order to do this.
706  |      **/
707  |     if((char *) NULL == (full_path = stringer(NULL, 0,
708  | 	path,"/",modulename, NULL)))
709  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
710  | 	    goto unwind0;
711  |     pathlen = strlen(full_path);
712  |     
713  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
714  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "full_path='", full_path, "'", NULL);
715  | #endif
716  |     /**
717  |      **  Check whether this file exists. If it doesn't free up everything
718  |      **  and return on failure
719  |      **/
720  |     if( stat( full_path, &stats))
721  | 	goto unwind2;
722  |     /**
723  |      **  If the suggested module file is a regular one, we've found what we've
724  |      **  seeked for. Put it on the top of the list and return.
725  |      **/
726  |     if( S_ISREG( stats.st_mode)) {
727  | 	*listcnt = 1;
728  | 	filelist[0] = strdup( modulename);
729  | 
730  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
731  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Module '", modulename, "' found", NULL);
732  | #endif
733  | 
734  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
735  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
736  |     }
737  |     /**
738  |      **  What we've found is a directory
739  |      **/
740  |     if( S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
741  |         char	*tbuf;		/** Buffer for the whole filename for each   **/
742  | 				/** content of the directory		     **/
743  |         char	*mpath;		/** Pointer into *tbuf where to write the dir**/
744  | 				/** entry				     **/
745  | 
746  | 	/**
747  | 	 **  Open the directory for reading
748  | 	 **/
749  | 	if( NULL == (subdirp = opendir( full_path))) {
750  | #if 0
751  | 	/* if you can't open the directory ... is that really an error? */
752  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPENDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL))
753  | #endif
754  | 	    goto unwind2;
755  | 	}
756  | 	/**
757  | 	 **  Allocate a buffer for constructing complete file names
758  | 	 **  and initialize it with the directory part we do already know.
759  | 	 **/
760  |         if( NULL == (tbuf = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, full_path,"/", NULL)))
761  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
762  | 		goto unwind3;
763  | 
764  |         mpath = (tbuf + pathlen + 1);
765  | 	/**
766  | 	 **  Now scan all entries of the just opened directory
767  | 	 **/
768  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
769  | 	ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Reading directory '", full_path, "'", NULL);
770  | #endif
771  | 	for( file = readdir( subdirp), i = 0, j = 0;
772  | 	     file != NULL;
773  | 	     file = readdir( subdirp), i++) {
774  | 	    /**
775  | 	     **  Oops! This one exceeds our array. Enlarge it.
776  | 	     **/
777  | 	    if( j == n)
778  | 		if( NULL == (filelist =
779  | 		    (char**) realloc((char*) filelist, (n*=2)*sizeof(char*))))
780  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
781  | 			goto unwindt;
782  | 	    /**
783  | 	     **  Now, if we got a real entry which is not '.*' or '..' and
784  | 	     **  finally is not a temporary file (which are defined to end
785  | 	     **  on '~' ...
786  | 	     **/
787  | 	    if( file->d_name                && 
788  |                 *file->d_name != '.'        && 
789  |                 strcmp( file->d_name, "..")  &&
790  |                 file->d_name[ NLENGTH( file) - 1] != '~') {
791  | 		/**
792  | 		 **  ... build the full pathname and check for the magic
793  | 		 **  cookie or for another directory level in order to
794  | 		 **  validate this as a modulefile entry we're seeking for.
795  | 		 **/
796  |                 strcpy( mpath, file->d_name);
797  |                 if( check_magic( tbuf, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE,
798  | 			MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH) ||
799  | 		    !stat(tbuf, &stats) ) {
800  | 		    /**
801  | 		     **  Yep! Found! Put it on the list
802  | 		     **/
803  |                     if((char *) NULL == (filelist[j] = stringer(NULL,0,
804  | 			modulename,"/",file->d_name, NULL)))
805  | 			if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
806  | 			    goto unwindt;
807  | 		    j++;
808  |                 } /** if( mag. cookie or directory) **/
809  | 	    } /** if( not a dotfile) **/
810  | 	} /** for **/
811  | 	/**
812  | 	 **  Put a terminator at the lists end and then sort the list
813  | 	 **/
814  |         filelist[ j] = NULL;
815  | 	qsort( (void*) filelist, (size_t) j, sizeof(char*), filename_compare);
816  | 	/**
817  | 	 **  Free up temporary values ...
818  | 	 **/
819  | 	if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
820  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL)) {
821  | 		goto unwind2;
822  | 	    }
823  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
824  | 	null_free((void*) &tbuf);
825  | 	/**
826  | 	 **  Set up return values and pass the created list to the caller
827  | 	 **/
828  | 	*listcnt = j;
829  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
830  | 	
831  | 	if(0) {	
832  | unwindt:
833  | 	    null_free((void*) &tbuf);
834  | 	    goto unwind3;
835  | 	}
836  |     }
837  |     /**
838  |      **  If it is nor a regular file, neither a directory, we don't support
839  |      **  it at all ...
840  |      **/
841  | /** ??? What about links ??? **/
842  | 
843  | unwind3:
844  |     if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
845  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL);
846  | unwind2:
847  |     null_free((void*) &full_path);
848  | unwind1:
849  |     FreeList( filelist, n);
850  | 
851  | unwind0:
852  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
853  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
854  | #endif
855  | 
856  |     return( NULL);			/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
857  | 
858  | } /** End of 'SortedDirList' **/
859  | 
860  | /*++++
861  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
862  |  ** 									     **
863  |  **   Function:		SplitIntoList					     **
864  |  ** 									     **
865  |  **   Description: 	Splits a path-type environment variable into an array**
866  |  **			of char* list.					     **
867  |  ** 									     **
868  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
869  |  ** 									     **
870  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
871  |  **			char		*pathenv	Path to split 	     **
872  |  **			int		*numpaths	Buffer to write the  **
873  |  **							number of array ele- **
874  |  **							ments to.	     **
875  |  ** 									     **
876  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param.)  **
877  |  **					else	Base pointer of the created  **
878  |  **						array			     **
879  |  **			*numpaths		Number of elements if an ar- **
880  |  **						ray has been created, unchan-**
881  |  **						ged otherwise.		     **
882  |  ** 									     **
883  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
884  |  ** 									     **
885  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
886  |  ++++*/
887  | 
888  | char	**SplitIntoList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
889  | 		     		char		*pathenv, 
890  | 		     		int		*numpaths,
891  | 				const char	*delim) 
892  | {
893  |     char	**pathlist = NULL;	/** Temporary base pointer for the   **/
894  | 					/** array to be created		     **/
895  |     char	 *givenpath = NULL;	/** Temporary buffer used to tokenize**/
896  | 					/** the passed input path	     **/
897  |     char	 *dirname = NULL;	/** Token pointer		     **/
898  |     int     	  i, 			/** Counts the number of elements    **/
899  | 		  n;			/** Size of the array		     **/
900  | 
901  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
902  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SplitIntoList, NULL);
903  | #endif
904  |     /** 
905  |      **  Paramter check
906  |      **/
907  |     if( !pathenv)
908  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "pathenv", NULL))
909  | 	    goto unwind0;
910  |     /**
911  |      **  Allocate space to copy in the value of the path value to
912  |      **  split. Thus this procedure doesn't change its input parameters.
913  |      **/
914  |     if( (char *) NULL == (givenpath = stringer(NULL,0, pathenv,NULL)))
915  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
916  | 	    goto unwind0;
917  |     /**
918  |      **  Allocate the list which is an array of char*.  n is used to
919  |      **  manage the array's growth if there are more than 100 paths in
920  |      **  the list.
921  |      **  Copy the passed path into the new buffer.
922  |      **/
923  |     if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) calloc(n = 100,sizeof( char*))))
924  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
925  | 	    goto unwind1;
926  |     /**
927  |      **  Split the given path environment variable into its components.
928  |      **/
929  |     for( i=0, dirname = xstrtok( givenpath, delim);
930  |          dirname;
931  | 	 dirname = xstrtok( NULL, delim)) {
932  | 	/**
933  | 	 **  Oops! The number of tokens exceed my array - reallocate it
934  | 	 **  and double its size!
935  | 	 **/
936  | 	if( i == n )
937  | 	    if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) realloc((char*) pathlist,
938  | 		(n *= 2)*sizeof(char*))))
939  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
940  | 		    goto unwind1;
941  | 	/**
942  | 	 **  Put the token into the array. Therefor a new area is allocated for
943  | 	 **  the token using 'xdup' - which expands 1 level of env.vars.
944  | 	 **/
945  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist[ i++] = xdup( dirname)))
946  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
947  | 		FreeList( pathlist, --i);
948  | 		goto unwind1;
949  | 	    }
950  |     } /** for **/
951  |     /**
952  |      **  Free up the temporary working array
953  |      **/
954  |     if( givenpath)
955  | 	null_free((void*) &givenpath);
956  |     /**
957  |      **  Set up the return value (Number of elements allocated) and pass
958  |      **  the arrays base pointer to the caller
959  |      **/
960  |     *numpaths = i;
961  |     return( pathlist);
962  | 
963  | unwind1:
964  |     null_free((void *) &givenpath);
965  | unwind0:
966  |     return( NULL);			/** -------- EXIT FAILURE -------> **/
967  | } /** End of 'SplitIntoList' **/
968  | 
969  | #ifndef FreeList
970  | 
971  | /*++++
972  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
973  |  ** 									     **
974  |  **   Function:		FreeList					     **
975  |  ** 									     **
976  |  **   Description:	Frees a char* array type list.			     **
977  |  ** 									     **
978  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
979  |  ** 									     **
980  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		Pointer to the list	     **
981  |  **			int	  numelem	Number of elements in the    **
982  |  ** 						list			     **
983  |  **   Result:		-						     **
984  |  ** 									     **
985  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
986  |  ** 									     **
987  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
988  |  ++++*/
989  | 
990  | void FreeList(	char	**list,
991  | 		int	  numelem)
992  | {
993  |     register int j;
994  |     
995  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
996  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_FreeList, NULL);
997  | #endif
998  |     /**
999  |      **  Nothing to do ?
1000 |      **/
1001 |     if( !list)
1002 | 	return;
1003 |     /**
1004 |      **  Free all elements of the list
1005 |      **/
1006 |     for( j = 0; j < numelem; j++)
1007 | 	if( list[j] != NULL)
1008 | 	    null_free((void *) (list + j));
1009 |     /**
1010 |      **  Free the entire list
1011 |      **/
1012 |     null_free((void *) &list);
1013 | 
1014 | } /** End of 'FreeList' **/
1015 | 
1016 | #endif
1017 | 
1018 | /*++++
1019 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1020 |  ** 									     **
1021 |  **   Function:		SourceRC					     **
1022 |  ** 									     **
1023 |  **   Description:	Source the passed global RC file		     **
1024 |  ** 									     **
1025 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1026 |  ** 									     **
1027 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
1028 |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
1029 |  **			char		*name		Name of the RC file  **
1030 |  **									     **
1031 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1032 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1033 |  **									     **
1034 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1035 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1036 |  **					control everything		     **
1037 |  ** 									     **
1038 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1039 |  ++++*/
1040 | 
1041 | int SourceRC( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1042 | {
1043 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1044 |     int 	  save_flags, i;
1045 |     char	 *buffer;
1046 |     int		  Result = TCL_OK;
1047 |     static char	**srclist = (char **) NULL;
1048 |     static int	  listsize = 0, listndx = 0;
1049 | 
1050 |     /**
1051 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1052 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1053 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1054 |      **/
1055 |     if( !path || !name)
1056 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1057 | 
1058 |     if( !interp)
1059 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1060 |     /**
1061 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file
1062 |      **  Avoid duplicate sourcing
1063 |      **/
1064 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",name, NULL)))
1065 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1066 | 	    goto unwind0;
1067 |     /**
1068 |      **  Check whether the RC file exists and has the magic cookie inside
1069 |      **/
1070 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1071 | 	if( check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1072 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
1073 | 	    /**
1074 | 	     **  Set the flags to 'load only'. This prevents from accidently
1075 | 	     **  printing something
1076 | 	     **/
1077 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1078 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1079 | 	    /**
1080 | 	     **  Source now
1081 | 	     **/
1082 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) 
1083 | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_SOURCE, LOC, buffer, NULL)) 
1084 | 		    Result = TCL_ERROR;
1085 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1086 | 	    /**
1087 | 	     **  Save the currently sourced file in the list
1088 | 	     **  Check whether the list is big enough to fit in a new entry
1089 | 	     **/
1090 | 	    if( !listsize) {
1091 | 		listsize = SRCFRAG;
1092 | 		if((char **) NULL
1093 | 			== (srclist = (char **) module_malloc( listsize *
1094 | 		    sizeof( char **)))) {
1095 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1096 | 		    goto unwind1;
1097 | 		}
1098 | 	    } else if( listndx + 1 >= listsize) {
1099 | 		listsize += SRCFRAG;
1100 | 		if((char **) NULL == (srclist = (char **) realloc( srclist, 
1101 | 		    listsize * sizeof( char **)))) {
1102 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1103 | 		    goto unwind1;
1104 | 		}
1105 | 	    }
1106 | 	    /**
1107 | 	     **  Put the current RC files name on the list
1108 | 	     **/
1109 | 	    srclist[ listndx++] = buffer;
1110 | 
1111 | 	} else {
1112 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1113 | 	    null_free((void *) &buffer);
1114 | 	}
1115 |     } /** if( !stat) **/
1116 |     /**
1117 |      **  Return our result
1118 |      **/
1119 |     return( Result);
1120 | 
1121 | unwind1:
1122 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1123 | unwind0:
1124 |     return( TCL_ERROR);
1125 | 
1126 | } /** End of 'SourceRC' **/
1127 | 
1128 | /*++++
1129 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1130 |  ** 									     **
1131 |  **   Function:		SourceVers					     **
1132 |  ** 									     **
1133 |  **   Description:	Source the '.version' file			     **
1134 |  ** 									     **
1135 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1136 |  ** 									     **
1137 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
1138 |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
1139 |  **			char		*name		Name of the module   **
1140 |  **									     **
1141 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1142 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1143 |  **									     **
1144 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1145 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1146 |  **					control everything		     **
1147 |  ** 									     **
1148 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1149 |  ++++*/
1150 | 
1151 | int SourceVers( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1152 | {
1153 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1154 |     int save_flags;
1155 |     char *buffer;
1156 |     char *modname;			/** ptr to module part of name	     **/
1157 |     int Result = TCL_OK;
1158 |     char *version;
1159 |     char *new_argv[3];
1160 |     char *mod, *ver;
1161 | 
1162 |     /**
1163 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1164 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1165 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1166 |      **/
1167 |     if( !path || !name)
1168 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1169 |     if( !interp)
1170 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1171 |     /**
1172 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file and check whether it exists and
1173 |      **  has the magic cookie inside
1174 |      **/
1175 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",version_file,
1176 | 	NULL)))
1177 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1178 | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);
1179 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1180 | 	if(
1181 | #if VERSION_MAGIC != 0
1182 | 	    check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1183 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)
1184 | #else
1185 | 	1
1186 | #endif
1187 | 	) {
1188 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1189 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1190 | 
1191 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR != (Result = Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) && 
1192 | 		(version = (char *) Tcl_GetVar(interp, "ModulesVersion", 0))) {
1193 | 		/**
1194 | 		 **  The version has been specified in the
1195 | 		 **  '.version' file. Set up the result code
1196 | 		 **/
1197 | 		/* for deep modulefile dirs ... just use lowest part */
1198 | 		if (!(modname = (char*) strrchr( name, '/'))) {
1199 | 			modname = name;
1200 | 		} else {
1201 | 			modname++;
1202 | 		}
1203 | 		null_free((void *) &buffer);
1204 | 		if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0,
1205 | 		modname,"/",version, NULL)))
1206 | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1207 | 			return( TCL_ERROR);
1208 | 
1209 | 		new_argv[0] = "module-version";
1210 | 		new_argv[1] = buffer;
1211 | 		new_argv[2] = _default;
1212 | 		/**
1213 | 		 **  Define the default version
1214 | 		 **/
1215 | 		if( TCL_OK != cmdModuleVersion( (ClientData) 0,
1216 | 		    (Tcl_Interp *) NULL, 3, (CONST84 char **) new_argv)) {
1217 | 			Result = TCL_ERROR;
1218 | 		}
1219 | 	    } /** if( Execute...) **/
1220 | 
1221 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1222 | 
1223 | 	} else
1224 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1225 | 
1226 |     } /** if( !stat) **/
1227 |     /**
1228 |      ** free buffer memory
1229 |      **/
1230 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1231 |     /**
1232 |      **  Result determines if this was successful
1233 |      **/
1234 | 
1235 |     return( Result);
1236 | 
1237 | } /** End of 'SourceVers' **/
1238 |
